text: this is get eaten for the New York Times
with apps like Noah radar Pro you can
make the most of the season whether you
need to be careful of the weather or
enjoy it for the snow Noah radar pro is
a two dollar iOS app and it's a great
weather forecasting and alert system the
app has a minimalist and simple look and
feel and is designed to deliver weather
forecast for the next several days
including radar maps and satellite
imagery best of all as a built-in alert
system so your phone can automatically
warn you ahead of time if there's a
particularly bad winter storm coming
your way and talking of winter storms
every year on the news you see reports
of people stuck in their cars in which
case the winter survival kit app may be
a very handy tool if you ever find
yourself snowed into your vehicle the
apps tray basic in terms of design but
this simplicity goes hand-in-hand with
ease of use the first most important
section of this app is the bit where it
tells you how to prepare your car with
an emergency kit full of useful if not
critical items the main section of the
app comes after you press the i'm
stranded button here you'll find
important advice about what to do like
staying inside your vehicle and other
important content like emergency contact
numbers the winter survival kit app is
free on both iOS and Android as a keen
skier I have to remind you that snow can
be fun too and the under snow ski and
snow report app which is free on both
iOS and Android is a great way to keep
up to date about weather and snow
conditions at your favorite ski resort
at a glance you can find out about
upcoming weather and other important
things like how many of the ski lifts
are open and you can even check out
what's going on on the slopes via photos
and reports that other users have
uploaded the app probably won't replace
your paper ski trail maps but it is
pretty good and that's it for this week
be careful in the snow
